name: rngogrpo

stmt.origin: syl(wcel(c0, crngo), wcel(c1, cgr), wcel(c1, cablo))
stmt.pretty: syl(c0 ∈ RingOps, c1 ∈ GrpOp, c1 ∈ AbelOp)

body.origin:
|- wi(wcel(c0, crngo), wcel(c1, cgr))
-| wi(wcel(c0, crngo), wcel(c1, cablo))
-| wi(wcel(c1, cablo), wcel(c1, cgr))
body.pretty:
⊢ (c0 ∈ RingOps → c1 ∈ GrpOp)
⊣ (c0 ∈ RingOps → c1 ∈ AbelOp)
⊣ (c1 ∈ AbelOp → c1 ∈ GrpOp)

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(wcel(c0, crngo), wcel(c1, cgr))
-| wi(wcel(c0, crngo), wcel(c1, cablo))
-| wi(wcel(c1, cablo), wcel(c1, cgr))
cumulated.pretty:
⊢ (c0 ∈ RingOps → c1 ∈ GrpOp)
⊣ (c0 ∈ RingOps → c1 ∈ AbelOp)
⊣ (c1 ∈ AbelOp → c1 ∈ GrpOp)

body.origin:
|- wi(wcel(c0, crngo), wcel(c1, cablo))
-| wceq(c1, cfv(c1st, c0))

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(wcel(c0, crngo), wcel(c1, cgr))
-| wi(wcel(c1, cablo), wcel(c1, cgr))
-| wceq(c1, cfv(c1st, c0))
cumulated.pretty:
⊢ (c0 ∈ RingOps → c1 ∈ GrpOp)
⊣ (c1 ∈ AbelOp → c1 ∈ GrpOp)
⊣ c1 =(1st ` c0)

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(wcel(c0, crngo), wcel(c1, cgr))
-| wceq(c1, cfv(c1st, c0))

comment: A ring's addition operation is a group operation. (Contributed by Steve Rodriguez, 9-Sep-2007.) (New usage is discouraged.)
